incidents.name: Increased errors and latencies on the High-Performance Edge Network in the Frankfurt region

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

From 12:20 UTC to 12:50 UTC, there was increased latency and there were errors on the High-Performance Edge Network in the Frankfurt region. We have mitigated the issues, and the team will continue to monitor.
Starting at 12:20 UTC, we are seeing increased latency and errors on the High-Performance Edge Network in the Frankfurt region.

incidents.name: Degraded builds due to GitHub incident

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 15:25 UTC, we saw some build failures as a result of an active GitHub incident. This affected around 177 sites and around 500 builds. This incident was resolved at 16:03 UTC.

incidents.name: Outage of Analytics, RUM and Billing Overview features

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix for this issue has been deployed and we will continue to monitor.

At 8:38am UTC, we observed an outage with our Analytics, RUM, and Billing Overview features. Our engineers have identified the source of this issue and are working to resolve. We have confirmed no data has been lost during this outage.

incidents.name: Elevated Rate of Lambda Errors

incident_updates.body: Between 18:17 and 19:10 UTC, we experienced an increased rate of lambda errors and latency, which impacted both streaming and buffered function responses. This issue has been resolved.

components.name: Netlify Functions

incidents.name: Incorrect function deployments affecting some Starter accounts

incident_updates.body: On July 3rd between 10:34 - 12:06, and on July 4th between 09:07 - 10:29 (UTC times), our build system produced incorrect function deployments for a small subset of customers, which resulted in runtime errors with the 502 status code. This only affected a small subset of Starter accounts. We’ve fixed the underlying problem and we’re working on improving our monitoring and alerting on the matter. Meanwhile affected customers can fix the problem by redeploying.

incidents.name: Problem serving some Next.js sites using Next.js runtime older then 4.41.3

incident_updates.body: We have identified the root cause and have a fix ready. Unfortunately, the fix cannot be rolled out to our network but would require an impacted site to be redeployed individually. Upgrading to Next.js Runtime v4.41.3 will resolve the issues. If you cannot upgrade your Next.js Runtime to v4.41.3, please reach out to our support team.
Our team is still investigating the root cause of the incident.

incidents.name: High error rates on our legacy load balancer

incident_updates.body: At 11:52 UTC This incident has been resolved.

Starting at 11:21 UTC we are seeing an increase in error rates and latencies on our legacy load balancer. The team is currently investigating. Users using 104.198.14.52 as the load balancer for their apex domains were affected. Please refer to our current load balancer details in our docs: https://docs.netlify.com/domains-https/custom-domains/configure-external-dns/#configure-an-apex-domain

incidents.name: Failure to receive Edge Functions logs on the Standard Edge Network

incident_updates.body: We have identified an issue that caused Edge Functions logs to not reach our systems on the Standard Edge Network from November 29th, 13:00 UTC until Nov 30th, 11:00 UTC. The invocations of Edge Functions were not impacted, and the logs on the HP Edge Network continued to be delivered. Our team has rolled out a fix and the issue has been resolved.
